translation.title: The Interior Was Impermanent in the Past

next.name: The Interior Will Be Impermanent in the Future

previous.name: Desire, Etc. for the Not-Self Exterior

segments.en: 186. The Interior Was Impermanent in the Past

segments.pli: “Cakkhu, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ atītaṃ … pe … jivhā aniccā atītā … pe … mano anicco atīto.
segments.en: “Mendicants, in the past the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind were impermanent.

segments.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako cakkhusmimpi nibbindati … pe … jivhāyapi nibbindati … pe … manasmimpi nibbindati.
segments.en: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

segments.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati; vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.

segments.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānātī”ti.
segments.en: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”

sections.title: “Mendicants, in the past the eye, ear, nose, tongue,…

suttaplex.translated_title: The Interior Was Impermanent in the Past
